unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: The Perfect Vacation: A Two Way Table
question_text:
At a travel expo, $180$ women and $180$ men were randomly selected to be surveyed. From a list of $7$ options, each individual was asked to identify where they would go for "the perfect vacation". The results of the survey are displayed below.
If an individual who was surveyed said their perfect vacation would be at the beach or on a cruise, what is the probability that the individual surveyed was a woman?
If an individual who was surveyed said their perfect vacation would be at the beach or on a cruise, what is the probability that the individual surveyed was a woman?
solution:
Start from the assumption that the individual surveyed answered either "beach" or "cruise". These responses represent a given condition which limits the sample space to $55+41+19+11$ or $126$ responses. Of these $126$ responses, $55+19$ or $74$ were from women.

Therefore, if the response was either "beach" or "cruise", the probability that the individual being surveyed was a woman is:

$$\dfrac{55+19}{55+41+19+11}=\dfrac{74}{126}=\dfrac{37}{63}$$

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect and represents the probability that an individual who was surveyed answered either "beach" or "cruise".

$$\dfrac{55+41+19+11}{180+180}=\dfrac{126}{360}=\dfrac{7}{20}$$

Choice 'B' is incorrect and provides the probability that the individual surveyed was a man given that they said either "beach" or "cruise".

$$\dfrac{41+11}{55+41+19+11}=\dfrac{52}{126}=\dfrac{26}{63}$$

Choice 'C' is incorrect and represents the probability that a woman who was surveyed said either "beach" or "cruise".

$$\dfrac{55+19}{55+26+33+17+21+9+19}=\dfrac{74}{180}=\dfrac{37}{90}$$

Choice 'E' is incorrect and represents the probability that someone who answered either "beach" or "mountains" was a woman.

$$\dfrac{55+26}{55+41+26+35}=\dfrac{81}{157}$$
